subject: 1030a 6/6 Update: Station spacewalk begins
body:
1030a 6/6 Update: Station spacewalk begins



=================================

CBS NEWS Coverage of Breaking Space News
Posted: 10:30 AM, 6/6/07

By William Harwood
CBS News Space Consultant

Changes and additions:

   06/06/07 (10:30 AM): Spacewalk begins

=================================

10:30 AM, 6/6/07, Update: Station spacewalk begins

Expedition 15 comnmander Fyodor Yurchikhin and flight engineer Oleg Kotov depressurized the Pirs airlock module and opened the hatch at 10:23 a.m. to officially kick off a planned six-hour spacewalk outside the international space station.

The goal of today's excursion is to install 12 micrometeoroid shields on the forward end of the Zvezda command module; to route an ethernet cable between the Russian and U.S. segments of the station; and to change out a hull-mounted experiment package. Yurchikhin and Kotov installed five debris shields last Wednesday and today's work will complete the job, giving the station's command module additional protection against potentially catastrophic impacts from micrometeoroids and space junk.

This is the 83rd spacewalk devoted to station assembly and maintenance since assembly began in 1998 and the sixth this year. Going into today's EVA, 46 NASA astronauts, 15 Russian cosmonauts and six fliers from Japan, Canada, Germany, France and Sweden had logged 503 hours and 28 minutes of spacewalk time building and maintaining the space station.
